Description: Fragment of plain weave linen with small tapestry (on grouped warp threads) motifs; Motifs in red, green, pink and yellow wool, arranged as a triple stripe with rows of rose buds on the outside and in the centre four-petalled roses seen from above, their green sepals forming Greek crosses; Red wool marker thread to one side of stripe; Part of a larger textile, perhaps a curtain; Warp: linen S spun, 19-20 tpc; Weft: linen and wool, S-spun, c.14-15 tpc in plain weave, c. 45-55 in tapestry; Edges: one plain selvedge at end of stripe, possibly internal
Curator's comments: Previous location Gallery 41,case 25; Information from Hero granger-Taylor (12.7.1989)
Condition: Good, worn and holed; conserved in 1984
Acquisition name: Purchased from: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
